column1: It was great to join students community leaders and residents of the Greater Muskegon area this morning at @MuskegonCC’s MLK Unity Breakfast. Thank you for continuing to have an open dialogue on the issues impacting Muskegon #WestMichigan and our nation.

Way to go Team Black River! When we had a chance to meet at school I could tell you would go far... I hope we can see each other in DC! Black River We the People team wins first state championship - News - Holland Sentinel - Holland MI.  https://t.co/J0Xakcqy9D

Big News! The #USMCA just passed the Senate and is heading to President Trump's desk. This modernization of our trade partnership with Canada and Mexico will benefit Michigan agriculture manufacturing and most importantly hardworking Michiganders! #WestMichigan #Opportunity
Just saw you @realMikeLindell along with @JackBrewerBSI on w @MariaBartiromo and you are an inspiration! I can’t wait to read your new book! @MorningsMaria
Thank you for making this incredibly powerful point @RepBrianMast. https://t.co/k5DJdGs00i
It's great to see another innovative #tech business choose to expand and create jobs in #WestMichigan! Welcome to Holland @ngcgroup! https://t.co/dOT2kTY9sB
@LukeStier @NickLaFave @JamalWZZM13 The lost art of the mid-range jumper.
@CortesSteve @MikeBloomberg This is a must watch...

Based on the information I received from General Milley the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs Staff the President moved on actionable intelligence to protect America our diplomats and our troops by eliminating the chief architect of terrorism across the Middle East.

While a potential escalation with Iran should be taken very seriously the non-binding show vote put forward by Speaker Pelosi and Congresswoman Elissa Slotkin has no enforcement and looks more like a political statement than any sort of legislative response.

While there is lots of talk surrounding an #AUMF & Iran that's not what is happening. Democrats have drafted an unserious resolution that by design cannot become law. This is a show vote that changes nothing and does not place limits on the President.

By attacking our men and women in uniform Iran has made a major mistake. While I am thankful initial reports indicate no American casualties I continue to pray for the safety of our troops on the ground as well as our decision makers.
A new FBO is under construction at GRR. It's great to see continued job creation investment and growth involving @FlyGRFord! https://t.co/83PhfzNtlj

For years Iran has killed American troops and conducted terror operations throughout the Middle East and beyond. The actions taken by the Administration demonstrate that the United States will hold Iran the world’s leading state sponsor of terror accountable.

As a community and as a country we must stand against attacks intended to instill fear in people of faith. Those seeking to do harm because of another person’s religious beliefs must be unequivocally rejected. We cannot allow anti-Semitic behavior to go unchallenged.

The #USMCA will strengthen our economy create jobs and provide new opportunities for communities around Michigan and across the nation. House passage of the USMCA is a win for Michigan workers farmers and job creators! https://t.co/0bVv2Lf1Ev
Heading to the House floor to talk about the importance of the #USMCA and the positive impact it will have on #WestMichigan #Michiganders and our nation.  You can turn on @cspan to follow the debate.
A great #WestMichigan story. Thanks for sharing this one @ghtribune! https://t.co/WzZhPXv8II
@NickLaFave unnecessary and inappropriate.
@KarenJoseph20 @tysonwevers11 Actually he’s sitting right next to me Karen. Have a good evening.

Tonight I voted against both highly partisan articles of impeachment. The actions taken by Speaker Pelosi and Adam Schiff during this process set a dangerous precedent for the future of our nation. You can read my full statement on impeachment here: https://t.co/lvSuv5LMvQ https://t.co/IEo5pmuTEl
Sen Mike Lee just walked onto the House floor to watch the proceedings.
Hey Norm if you were so close maybe you would know he went by “Jerry” not “Gerry”... a common mistake for those who aren’t friends of the family. https://t.co/XlqVRca0cn

2/2 Is it no longer necessary to break the law to be impeached as in all past impeachments? How would Pres Obama’s self-labeled “extra Constitutional” actions such as DACA etc NOT be an impeachable offense? Will Impeachment become a regular political weapon? Yes to the last Q.. https://t.co/Rm7R71VYpL

Sitting on the House Floor I can’t help but reflect on my time as a staffer during the Clinton impeachment and my experience as a Member during the Obama era. Today’s 2nd Article dramatically changes the threshold of an impeachable offense. One must ask questions such as: 1/2
If this were true why did so many Democrats vote for impeachment before the Ukraine call even took place? https://t.co/L4NH9iS2Hz

I am glad to see the House pass this important bipartisan measure! I hope the Senate will act in a similar manner.

H.R. 4344 strikes a delicate balance by ensuring that the SEC has the necessary tools to go after bad actors and prevent these sophisticated fraudsters from keeping the money they have stolen from our teachers military service personnel seniors and religious-affiliated groups.

The latest report from the SEC found that over 1.1 billion dollars that has been swindled from investors through fraudulent activity is unable to be recovered because of a 2017 Supreme Court decision.
Tonight the House passed my bipartisan bill with @RepBenMcAdams to hold criminals accountable and help Main Street investors recover their losses by a vote of 314-95.
